description: pseudo- +‎ science, 1796, originally "pſeudo-ſcience" in reference to alchemy.

entries.meaning: Any body of knowledge that purports to be scientific or to be supported by science but which fails to comply with the scientific method.
examples: The fantastical pseudo-science of alchemy has in all ages had its numerous votaries …

entries.meaning: Fictitious science as portrayed in science fiction.
